attributes.comment:
I'm commenting on USCIS-2006-0044:
I understand that there comes a time when fees must be evaluated and raised if necessary but it
seems like a big waste of money to require adopting families who've applied and received approval
(I-600A) to be limited to the 18 months timeframe. Our international adoption process is
unfortunately taking a lot longer and therefore, according to your expiration timeframe, we'll need to
reapply for approval. This is not only seems like a waste of our time and money, but it's wasting
YOUR time and money...likely affecting the need to increase these fees. Therefore, I strongly urge
you to not increase these fees and allow for a longer approval timeframe. This longer timeframe (24
months) is already being reviewed and considered in the House, H.R 628. Thank you.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Cheri L. Coohon
